standard_set: Common Core State Standards for Mathematics
source_note: Paraphrased for brevity. Refer to the official PDF on corestandards dot org for exact wording.

clusters.title: Know number names and the count sequence

standards.description: Count to one hundred by ones and by tens
Start from any known number and count forward without starting at one
Write numerals from zero to twenty and use them to show how many objects with zero for none

clusters.title: Count to tell the number of objects

standards.description: Relate numbers to quantities and connect counting to cardinality

components.description: When counting pair each object with exactly one number name in order
The final number said tells how many and it does not change with order or arrangement
Each next number name means one more

standards.description: Count to answer how many for up to twenty in a line array or circle and up to ten when scattered and count out a given number from one to twenty
Decide whether one group has more fewer or the same number of objects as another using matching or counting strategies
Compare two written numerals from one through ten

clusters.title: Understand addition as putting together and adding to and subtraction as taking apart and taking from

standards.description: Use objects drawings actions sounds verbal explanations expressions or equations to represent addition and subtraction
Solve addition and subtraction word problems and add and subtract within ten using objects or drawings to represent the situation
Break numbers up to ten into pairs in more than one way and record each as a drawing or an equation
For any number from one to nine find the number that makes ten and show it with objects drawings or an equation
Fluently add and subtract within five

domains.title: Number and Operations in Base Ten

clusters.title: Work with numbers eleven to nineteen to build foundations for place value

standards.description: Compose and decompose numbers eleven to nineteen as ten ones and some further ones using objects or drawings and record with drawings or equations
Describe measurable attributes such as length or weight including several attributes of one object
Directly compare two objects with a common attribute to decide which has more or less and describe the difference for example taller or shorter

clusters.title: Classify objects and count the number of objects in each category

standards.description: Classify objects into given categories count how many in each category and order the categories by count

clusters.title: Identify and describe shapes including squares circles triangles rectangles hexagons cubes cones cylinders and spheres

standards.description: Describe objects using shape names and use position words such as above below beside in front of behind and next to
Name shapes correctly regardless of orientation or size
Tell whether a shape is two dimensional flat or three dimensional solid

clusters.title: Analyze compare create and compose shapes

standards.description: Analyze and compare two and three dimensional shapes by size orientation and attributes such as sides and corners using informal language
Model shapes by building them from components and by drawing them
Compose simple shapes to make larger shapes for example join two triangles to make a rectangle

mathematical_practices.description: Make sense of problems and persist in solving them
Build arguments and examine others reasoning
Notice and make use of structure
Notice and express regularity in repeated reasoning

notes: In Kindergarten addition and subtraction problem groups use up to ten objects
Drawings should show the mathematics rather than detailed pictures whenever drawings are mentioned
For K MD 3 limit category counts to ten or fewer
